ARY.caption: layout
ARY.doc: an object specifying the way participantsâ€™ videos are laid out in the live stream.
ARY.name: layout

ARZ.caption: user id
ARZ.doc: If using the single-participant layout, specify the user id of the participant that the single participant layout should focus on. You can set a user id with the daily - create meeting token action.
ARZ.name: user_id

ARb.caption: If using the single-participant layout, specify the user id of the single participant. Set a user id with the Daily - create meeting token action.
ARb.name: singleParticipantInfo

ARc.caption: To unlock this action, you'll need to add a credit card to your account. Visit https://dashboard.daily.co/billing to learn more about pricing and add your credit card details.
ARc.name: scaleplanonly

ARd.caption: max streams
ARd.doc: Specify the number of max streams in the recording (from 1-9). The default value is 9.
ARd.name: maxstreams

ARf.caption: If using the portrait layout, you can specify the variant. The default is vertical which will display the call grid style. Inset will have one participant's video take up the entire screen and the other in a smaller rectangle.
ARf.name: portraitinfo

ARh.caption: height
ARh.doc: Specified to control the resolution of the live stream. The value must be even, i.e., a multiple of 2.
ARh.name: heightRecording

ARi.caption: width
ARi.doc: Specified to control the resolution of the live stream. The value must be even, i.e., a multiple of 2
ARi.name: widthRecording

ARj.caption: background color
ARj.doc: Specifies the background color of the stream, formatted as #rrggbb or #aarrggbb string.
ARj.name: backgroundColor

ARk.caption: video bitrate
ARk.doc: Specifies the video bitrate in kilobits per second (kbps) to use for video output. Value can range between 10 and 10000
ARk.name: videoBitrate

ARl.caption: audio bitrate
ARl.doc: Specifies the audio bitrate in kilobits per second (kbps) to use for audio output. Value can range between 10 and 320
ARl.name: audioBitrate

ARm.caption: Below are optional advanced recording settings to further configure the recording experience.
ARm.name: advanced_settings

ARo.caption: min Idle time out
ARo.doc: Amount of time in seconds to wait before ending a recording or live stream when the room is idle (e.g. when all users have muted video and audio).
ARo.name: minIdleTimeOut

ARp.caption: max duration
ARp.doc: maximum duration in seconds after which recording/streaming is forcefully stopped. Defaults: 10800 seconds (3 hours) for recordings
ARp.name: maxDuration
